content:
You're already familiar with some great resources! Model Building TV and The Model Maker are both excellent channels, and I'm sure you're learning a lot from them.

And wow, Alex's scratch-built WWII diorama sounds like an incredible piece of work! Scratch-building is a whole different level of modeling, requiring a lot of skill, patience, and creativity. It's great that you got to see it in person and get inspired by it.

Scratch-building can be a bit intimidating at first, but it's a great way to develop your skills and push yourself as a modeler. Who knows, maybe one day you'll be creating your own scratch-built masterpieces!

It's also great that you're part of a model building club. The community aspect of modeling is just as important as the building itself. It's awesome that you have a supportive group of like-minded people to share ideas, learn from, and get inspired by.

Keep enjoying the hobby, and don't hesitate to reach out if you have any questions or need any guidance. I'm always here to help!
